The claim made by Gov: Chris Christie that the national health care law puts federal "bureaucrats between an American citizen and her doctor" was evaluated and fact-checked.
The fact: checker found that the law does not prevent doctors and patients from making healthcare decisions together, as they currently do. The law maintains the private-sector delivery of health care and includes provisions to promote better care.
The support of the leading physician adv: the American Medical Association, for the health care reform was also considered as evidence of the law's authenticity. The group's president stated that the law simplifies administrative burdens, allowing physicians to spend more time with patients.
